result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Case called: 11:12 am
INCLUDES 15CF928 AND 15CM1842.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo:
Defendant appears in person and with Atty Andrew Morgan;
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
15CF928:
Ct. 2 (Maintain Drug Trafficking Place)>>DRI.

15CM1842:
Ct. 1 (Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal))>>DRI.
Ct. 2 (Ignitional Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install)>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
15CF928:
Ct. 1 (Possess w/Intent-THC)>> NO CONTEST.
Ct. 3 (Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin)>> NO CONTEST.
Ct. 4 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>NO CONTEST.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
15CF928:
Ct. 1 (Possess w/Intent-THC)>>  COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.
COURT defers matter for a period of 2 years for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to DISMISS Ct. 1.
DEOJ RH>> 1/28/2019 @ 9:00 am
Bond continues.

Ct. 3 (Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin)>> Sentence W/H- 1 Year Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Counseling as recommended, Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances unless prescribed and only within that prescribed amount, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. No objection for transfer to Dane County.

Ct. 4 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>> Sentence W/H- 1 Year Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Counseling as recommended, Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances unless prescribed and only within that prescribed amount, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. No objection for transfer to Dane County.

Adjourned: 11:22 am

INCLUDES 15CF928 AND 15CM1842.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears in person and with Atty Andrew Morgan.
Parties are to set a Preliminary Hearing on the new case.
Atty Morgan makes statement.
Jury Trial to be taken off and reset.
Adj: 10:52 am

DATES: Preliminary Hearing to be set. 
JT to be taken off and reset.
